timeline.message:
Add traceId to logging exporter

Signed-off-by: Pavol Loffay <ploffay@redhat.com>

timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: oh my bad thanks for the catch!
replies.author: pavolloffay

timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: printf is sloooow - can we switch back to appending?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Also looks like we're missing space between span ID and attributes now probably good to have that (or maybe enclose attributes in {}
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: No objection to switching back to appending. Good catch on the missing space 👍
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: @anuraaga Any numbers to back that claim? :) And is it important enough for us?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: Have benchmarked similar now and again, generally 10-20x slower. The readability difference is small enough to get the free speed, and I always recommend people to just never use printf in Java, unless formatting numbers, since it's not worth the cognitive load of deciding between one or the other the performance difference is too great. So I'd consider it important for us.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
I will submit a PR to use the appending.
Would it be better to use string builder
replies.author: pavolloffay
